intro: Epipactis exserta, commonly known as the slender helleborine, is a terrestrial orchid native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and is characterized by its long, narrow leaves and pale greenish-yellow flowers. The plant has a pseudobulb-like structure and produces a single spike of flowers with showy, spurred petals. Its flowers are pollinated by bees and other insects, and it is known for its ability to thrive in shaded environments. Epipactis exserta is a perennial plant that blooms from late spring to early summer.
